title: Bernie Sanders says he does not support open borders
content: The question is: What constitutes the alleged "crisis"? First, stereotypical secretive border crossings are at an historical low. Second, we are experiencing a huge increase of people seeking asylum at our border, who want, and do, turn themselves in. Third, under our current law, each and every one is due a hearing with an immigraiton judge. We desperately need many more judges to meet the demand. Fourth, Trump does not seek to follow the laws as they are. Rather than appoint judges, he wants to avoid the law and simply keep all of the asylum seekers out. It does not seem to occur to him that the judges might turn alot of the asylum seekers away. The "crisis" results from the US failure to abide by its own laws, and instead propose walls and military options and closings of the border. No attempts have been made to get Congress to change our asylum laws. So, the people keep coming, and the number not yet given hearings keeps growing. My take is that Trump needs to drum up fear of "the other" in order to appeal to his base. Its an old (and sadly effective) tactic, practiced all over the world for centuries. Including in the US.

That is the crisis, which Trump CAN do something about. Prohibition of US spending on trying to improve conditions where the asylum seekers are coming from is pure stupidity, and will only make the problem worse, even if some or most of the aid is misused.

title: Bernie Sanders says he does not support open borders
content: Trump is NOT supporting the "rule of law". Our asylum laws allow asylum seekers to come here, turn themselves in, and get a hearing on whether they can stay or not. Trump is not following that law. Instead, he conflates the asylum seekers with old style secretive border crossing (which is way down). He then proposes solutions that ignore our asylum law. He talks about walls and seeks to steal funding appropriated for other items. This is going to court on Constitutional grounds. He separates children from their parents as a "deterrent" to what is, as of now, lawful behavior. He teases us with proposals to close the entire border. But he never does what American Presidents used to do- pressure Congress to change the law (assuming that's what Trump wants). Trump could resolve the crisis with such a new law. Or, he could appoing more immigration judges so that the number of those seeking asylum goes down. Or, he could work with the three nations where most originate, so as to reduce the reasons they're coming. Instead, he's working this problem for maximum hysteria and xenophobia.

title: Bernie Sanders says he does not support open borders
content: The Canadian minimum wage is higher than the US minimum wage and stardard of living is generally higher, which is why there would be no influx of Canadians into the US if that border were open. In fact, Canada has a much, much, much more restrictive immigration policy than the US does, which is part of the reason their wages are higher. (Please research the laws of supply and demand to understand the effects of unlimited immigration. Even Cesar Chavez, the famed labor leader, was against open borders.) Mexico's minimum wage (if they have one) is lower than the US minimum wage, and millions of even poorer people move into Mexico intending to eventually cross the border into the US. That is why the southern US border is a problem, but the Canadian border is not.
